Invocation

Delivered by:  Rev. Jonathan Owhe, Christ the Rock International Church, 770-784 Glenmore Avenue, Brooklyn, NY 11208.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by COUNCIL MEMBER BARRON.

The Invocation was delivered by Rev. Jonathan Owhe, Christ the Rock International Church 770-784 Glenmore Avenue, Brooklyn, 11208.

Council Member Barron moved  that the Invocation be spread in full upon the Minutes and adopted.

Items.Title:
Introduction & Reading of Bills
See Attached
Discussion of Resolutions
Extension of Remarks
INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

Resolution acknowledging Rwanda’s move towards democracy, economic growth and development and the country’s attempt to bring diverse ethnic groups together in unity and peace since the violence and war of the early 1990’s.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Acknowledging Rwanda's move towards democracy, economic growth and development.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Montgomery, S.3434-A, and Assembly Member Boyland, A.7450-A, “AN ACT authorizing the city of New York to reconvey its interest in certain real property acquired December 9, 1985 by in rem tax foreclosure in the borough of Brooklyn, to Tanisha Weeks-Ferguson, notwithstanding expiration of the two year period within which application may be made to the city to release its interest in property thus acquired; Block No. 1663, Lot No. 18, on the tax map for the borough of Brooklyn”.
Items.MatterName: In rem, Tanisha Weeks-Ferguson, Brooklyn (S.3434-A, A.7450-A)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the charter of the city of New York, in relation to public notice prior to the permanent removal of any emergency medical service battalion.
Items.MatterName: Public notice prior to the permanent removal of any emergency medical service battalion.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to discharge planning services.
Items.MatterName: Preparing inmates for re-integration into society and providing inmates with assistance in applying for state-issued identification and government benefits.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the composition of the uniformed force of the department of correction.
Items.MatterName: Composition of the uniformed force of the department of correction.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Division of Probation and Correctional Alternatives to distribute State Probation funding equitably, especially recognizing the disproportionate share of adult felons and juvenile delinquents supervised by the New York City Department of Probation who would otherwise be confined in State custody.
Items.MatterName: NYS Division of Probation and Correctional Alternatives to distribute State Probation funding equitably.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Department of Health to abide by federal law requiring that incarcerated individuals are returned to Medicaid rolls immediately upon release, by suspending, rather than terminating, the Medicaid benefits of people incarcerated in city jails.
Items.MatterName: NYS Department of Health and NYC Department of Social Services to abide by federal law requiring that incarcerated individuals are returned to Medicaid rolls immediately upon release.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the limitation on removal of motor vehicles for purposes of satisfying parking violation judgments.
Items.MatterName: Limitation on removal of motor vehicles for purposes of satisfying parking violation judgments.

Items.Title: Resolution calling for a cost of living adjustment for all senior center employees and all employees who serve seniors whose employers receive funding through City contracts.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor due back on 9/20/2004.
Items.MatterName: Cost of living adjustment for all senior center employees and all employees who serve seniors whose employers receive funding through City contracts.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Department of Education to stop the practice of “pushing out” high school students and, instead, to track and seek to reinstate high school students under the age of 21 who were discharged, “pushed out,” or who dropped out of high school.
Items.MatterName: DOE to stop the practice of "pushing out" high school students.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring all city agencies to record and report information regarding workplace injuries.
Items.MatterName: Requiring all city agencies to record and report information regarding workplace injuries and illnesses.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the City of New York to join the coalition calling for the immediate shutdown of the Indian Point Nuclear Facility until comprehensive safety studies are completed and adequate security measures are taken.
Items.MatterName: Immediate shutdown of Indian Point Nuclear Facility.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to require all nonpublic schools to conduct criminal background checks on teachers, administrators and supervisors.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education due back on 9/20/2004.
Items.MatterName: Require all nonpublic schools to conduct criminal background checks on teachers, administrators and supervisors.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the issuance of temporary certificates of occupancy.
Items.MatterName: Issuance of temporary certificates of occupancy.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the issuance of building permits.
Items.MatterName: Issuance of building permits.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the City of New York, in relation to prohibiting owners of multiple dwellings from requiring tenants to present identifying documents to gain entry into the multiple dwelling.
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting owners of multiple dwellings from requiring tenants to present identifying documents to gain entry into the multiple dwelling.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring review by the landmarks preservation commission before a demolition permit may be issued.
Items.MatterName: Requiring review by the landmarks preservation commission before a demolition permit may be issued.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to home improvement contractors.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs due back on 8/13/2004.
Items.MatterName: Home improvement contractors.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the compliance of city contractors with state and federal laws concerning residential loans.
Items.MatterName: Compliance of city contractors with state and federal laws concerning residential loans.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the appropriate committee of the Council of the City of New York to conduct a hearing to investigate the allegations of human and labor rights abuses by Coca-Cola in Colombia.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Conduct a hearing to investigate the allegations of human and labor rights abuses by Coca-Cola in Colombia

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon Nielsen Media Research to delay the introduction of Local People Meter service in the New York City media market until such time as sufficient studies have been conducted to ensure fair and accurate counting of all New York City viewers regardless of race, ethnicity or national origin.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Nielsen Media Research to delay the introduction of Local People Meter service in the NYC media market.

Items.Title: Resolution commemorating April 25, 2004, as Yom Ha’Zikkaron, a day of remembrance for the Israeli soldiers killed in the struggle for Israeli Independence.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Commemorating April 25, 2004, as Yom Ha'Zikkaron

Items.Title: Resolution commemorating Yom Ha’Shoah, Holocaust Remembrance Day, on April 18, 2004
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Commemorating Yom Ha'Shoah, Holocaust Remembrance Day, on April 18, 2004.

Items.Title: Resolution commemorating Yom Ha’Atzma’Ut, Israeli Independence Day, on April 26, 2004.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Commemorating Yom Ha'Atzma'Ut, Israeli Independence Day, on April 26, 2004.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the appropriate Committee of the Council to conduct an oversight hearing on the ways in which the City of New York is protecting children and fetuses from air pollution.
Items.MatterName: Oversight hearing on the ways in which NYC is protecting children and fetuses from air pollution.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon United States Attorney General John Ashcroft and the Department of Justice to reopen the case of Emmett Till, in light of the discovery of new information, for a complete and thorough investigation into his 1955 murder, and to move aggressively to indict the murderers of Emmett Till, and bring them to justice.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations due back on 9/20/2004.
Items.MatterName: US Attorney General John Ashcroft and the Dep't of Justice to reopen the case of Emmett Till.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to exemption from taxation for alterations and improvements to multiple dwellings.
Items.MatterName: Exemption from taxation for alterations and improvements to multiple dwellings.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to exemption from taxation for alterations and improvements to multiple dwellings.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings due back on 8/13/2004.
Items.MatterName: Exemption from taxation for alterations and improvements to multiple dwellings.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to site eligibility limitations on benefits pursuant to section four hundred twenty-one-a of the real property tax law.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings due back on 8/13/2004.
Items.MatterName: Site eligibility limitations on benefits pursuant to section 421-a of the real property tax law.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the development of language access and outreach plans for one-stop centers.
Items.MatterName: Development of language access and outreach plans for one-stop centers.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Velella, S.4691-A, and Committee on Rules, A.8378-A, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing a variable supplements fund for sanitation members of the New York city employees’ retirement system”.
Items.MatterName: Establishing a variable supplements fund for sanitation members of the New York city employees' retirement system (S.4691-A, A.8378-A)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Velella, S.5968, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.9484, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to benefits for certain peace officers in the city of New York who are injured in the performance of their duties”.
Items.MatterName: Benefits for certain peace officers in the city of New York who are injured in the performance of their duties (S.5968, A.9484)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Sabini, Andrews and Smith, S.4460, and Assembly Member Lafayette, A.939, “AN ACT in relation to the control and stabilization of rents and rental agreements in certain retail commercial spaces in cities having a population of more than one million”.
Items.MatterName: Control and stabilization of rents and rental agreements (S.4460, A.939)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Scarborough, A.9975, “AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to requiring school speed limits to be no more than twenty miles per hour in cities having a population in excess of one million”.
Items.MatterName: Requiring school speed limits to be no more than twenty miles per hour (A.9975)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Padavan, S.4258-A, and Committee on Rules, A.8668-A, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to the employment of retired New York city police and fire department personnel”.
Items.MatterName: Employment of retired New York city police and fire department personnel (S.4258-A, A.8668-A)

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the City of New York to create apprenticeship and job opportunity programs through which unemployed New Yorkers can participate in upcoming public infrastructure projects.
Items.MatterName: Create apprenticeship and job opportunity programs through which unemployed New Yorkers can participate in upcoming public infrastructure projects.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the City of New York to create an emergency transitional jobs program targeted at increasing job opportunities and addressing structural underemployment.
Items.MatterName: Create an emergency transitional jobs program targeted at increasing job opportunities and addressing structural underemployment.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the State of New York to end the real property tax exemption granted to Madison Square Garden (“MSG” or the “Garden”) so that the revenue raised from putting MSG back on the City’s property tax rolls can be used to provide City services or tax relief to City residents.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance due back on 9/20/2004.
Items.MatterName: NYS to end the real property tax exemption granted to Madison Square Garden ("MSG" or the "Garden").

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the New York City Police Department to provide information to the City Council regarding school safety agents.
Items.MatterName: Requiring the NYPD and DOE to conduct an annual review and assessment of the need for school safety agents at each school operated by the DOE.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to authorizing an increase in the amount to be expended in five business improvement districts.
Items.MatterName: Authorizing an increase in the amount to be expended in five business improvement districts.

Items.Title: Resolution concerning the increase in the annual expenditure for the 34th Street, the 82nd Street, the Flatbush Avenue, the 47th Street and the Columbus/Amsterdam Business Improvement Districts and the setting of the time and place for the hearing of the local law increasing the annual expenditure for such districts.

Items.MatterName: Concerning the increase in the annual expenditure for the 34th Street, the 82nd Street, the Flatbush Avenue, the 47th Street and the Columbus/Amsterdam BIDs.

By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Katz:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council, Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter and Section 62-722(a) of the Zoning Resolution, the Council hereby resolves that the actions of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Applications no. C 030229 ZSM, a special permit and C 030230 PPM, a disposition, shall be subject to Council review. These applications are related to application no. N 030228 ZRY that is subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Call-Up was Approved, by Council
Items.MatterName: Zoning Resolution, Brooklyn (C 030229 ZSM)
